intro: Solanum duplo-sinuatum var. semiglabrum, commonly known as the smooth-leaved nightshade, is a member of the Solanaceae family. It is characterized by its oval to elliptical leaves that are typically smooth or only slightly hairy. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its fruits are berries that mature to a dark purple or black color. This variety is native to certain regions of South America and is often found in tropical and subtropical habitats.
